text: hey everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd
hair is growing in and it's time for a
review of the new ghost poet album
someone says
some say i so i say light this is the
sophomore full length lp from this uk
based
rapper i first heard of him back in 2011
through the album peanut butter blues
and
melancholy jam i wasn't huge on the lp
but nonetheless i did kind of see it as
this
recent rise where i saw it as a part of
this recent rise in alternative
forms of hip-hop or just alternative
flavors and new faces in hip hop people
like danny brown jabez palaces kendrick
lamar
milo death grips asap rocky and action
bronson 2 action bronson didn't start
that year a lot of the people who i just
listed didn't start that year but they
did come out with notable records that
year that did manage to catch a lot of
attention and for sure ghost poet had
his own sort of approach that that made
him worth
noting he had a lot of atmospheric beats
on this lp a really sort of slow
understated somewhat whispered flow
vocal delivery to be honest ghost poet
felt a lot more like a ghost than he did
a poet considering just how obscured he
was and how hard it was to make out some
of what he was saying in these tracks
his really understated flow in his voice
which was kind of smudged by effects and
and some really low mixing
for me personally made him come off much
less than
gripping i still admired his will to
experiment though i was hoping that his
next album would catch my ears a little
bit more and i i guess i could say in a
way that this sophomore album has though
i'm not really in love with it for one
ghost poet does diversify
his
sound his his vocal style his
instrumentals with some beats on here
that do feel hip-hop influence but are
much more electronic tracks on here have
a pretty huge future garage influence as
well with the instrumental and a few
moments here i would actually say are
reminiscent of and furthermore some
tracks like plastic bag brain the
instrumental there it's it's essentially
just a rock song instrumental a subtle
rock instrumental but still a rock
instrumental now as far as ghost poet's
voice he's much more front and center
much more audible his lyrics
intelligible his emotions
sort of tangible however after giving
this lp a listen i can't really say
maybe better production and just
clearer vocals were what ghost poet
needed if anything this album is is
lacking
a captivating vocal performance and and
lyrics to back that up one track after
another ghost poet delivers these
haphazard sort of
boring vocalizations
uh they just sound sort of silly at
times and and for many tracks here as
well
he seems to be singing with this
forcefully lethargic
attitude it's like he's really too tired
to put the emotion necessary to
captivate an audience into his singing
and it's not like he tries to hide his
listless attitude for sure it's it's uh
decidedly
this way with some track titles on here
like sloth trot or comatose however
there's nothing on this lp musically
lyrically or emotionally that makes me
feel some kind of emotion in reaction to
his
sluggishness
at the end of the day when i give a
listen to this lp i just feel like i am
a spectator to somebody else's rainy day
or spilled milk i feel like a little bit
i'm listening to the the hip-hop
equivalent to the new national record or
something the prettiest thing on this
record has got to be the instrumentals
and there are some good instrumental
choices on here the string sections at
the end of comatose are great some of
the more future garage influence beats
have nice grooves to them especially the
opener and the synthesizer melody the
very sort of simple synthesizer melody
which has a driving groove to it on the
song them waters it's it's very moody
it's very electrified it's very
nocturnal again i i like a lot of the
instrumentals here but none of them are
so redeeming that i'm really able to get
into this new ghost poet album and uh
enjoy the songs as they currently are
truth be told the this album really
truly
underwhelms me and and there's not much
more to it than that really
if you've given this lp a listen what
did you think of it did you love it hate
it why
what do you think i should review next
and
that's it
anthony fantano
ghost poet
forever
you
